text: One night I dreamt I had killed a woman. I'll go through the details. When I woke up I read in the newspaper the story of the crime just as I had committed it. I went to the police. They laughed at me. They say they found the criminal. What's going on? Then why does my conscience keep on remorseful? Bells are ringing, 1926
title: El crimen perfecto
author: Luis Vidales
